timeline.message:
Stabilizing 4 flaky tests

Four tests has been stabilized in this commit.
These tests are:
1-TestJobFailure
2-TestRebalanceRunningTask
3-TestTaskRebalancerStopResume
4-TestTaskSchedulingTwoCurrentStates

timeline.bodyText: Make sure external view has been created for the resource...
timeline.author: narendly

timeline.bodyText: If you're expecting null, there's really no reason to use getOrDefault?
timeline.author: narendly

replies.bodyText: In this case, a simple containsKey check would do..
replies.author: narendly

timeline.author: narendly

timeline.bodyText: A counter is enough, no need to create a HashSet, right?
timeline.author: huizhilu

replies.bodyText: Please note that we want to make sure that the master for two different resources are existed in two different instances. Counter is also possible. However, I still think this implementation in more readable. Specially considering that this is only a test.
replies.author: alirezazamani

timeline.bodyText: Nit, I would just do assertTrue(TestHelper.verify()); to get rid of the temp boolean isExternalViewCreated var to minimize variable scope. Same for following usages.
timeline.author: huizhilu

timeline.bodyText: Is externalView possible to be null?
timeline.author: huizhilu

replies.bodyText: Yeah it is possible. I added new check for the null EV.
replies.author: alirezazamani

timeline.bodyText: These checks could be simplified to "MASTER".equals(stateMap.get(PARTICIPANT_PREFIX + "_" + (_startPort + 1)));
timeline.author: huizhilu
narendly

timeline.bodyText: Could we declare it as Set instead of HashSet here?
timeline.author: narendly

timeline.bodyText: Nit: "two masters exist on two different instances"
timeline.author: narendly
narendly

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to do a null check on stateMap here?
timeline.author: narendly
